page.title: 02The village of Holcot
page.content: Holcot village has a population of 344 people of whom about 70 are still attending school.There are{127 houses, most of which are freehold owner occupied. There is an estate of 27 council houses on the south side of the village. Two houses in the village do not have a bath and a further eight still have only{outside toilets. Although there is a regular bus service, many people find owning a car essential.Only 34 homes do not have use of a private car. 47 homes have one car, 41 homes own two cars and 5 homes own three or more cars. The village has one{small shop which is also a sub-post office. Children travel to school by bus, either attending Brixworth Primary or Moulton Secondary Schools.
